# harness_fme_environment (Resource)

Resource for creating a FME (Feature Management Engine) environment.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "harness_fme_environment" "staging" {
  workspace_id = "your-workspace-uuid"
  name         = "staging"
  production   = false
}

# Access the automatically created API tokens
output "server_side_token_id" {
  value = harness_fme_environment.staging.api_tokens[0].id
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the environment.
- `workspace_id` (String) Unique identifier of the workspace.

### Optional

- `production` (Boolean) Whether this is a production environment.
- `remove_environment_from_state_only` (Boolean) If true, the environment will only be removed from Terraform state and not deleted from the API.

### Read-Only

- `api_tokens` (List of Object) Automatically created API tokens for this environment. These are generated by Split.io when the environment is created. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--api_tokens))
- `id` (String) Unique identifier of the environment.

<a id="nestedatt--api_tokens"></a>
### Nested Schema for `api_tokens`

Read-Only:

- `api_key_type` (String) API key type (e.g., 'server-side', 'client-side').
- `id` (String) Unique identifier of the API token.
- `name` (String) Name of the API token.
- `type` (String) Type of the API token.
